spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning roughly resembles the plan (3 bedrooms distributed left/center-right, living/dining central, kitchen at right, balconies at left and top), but the internal wall layout deviates substantially. The 2D plan’s straight wide passages (left 1.10m, right 1.05m) are not preserved; the 3D introduces curved partitions and an open-flow core that changes room boundaries and circulation. Multiple doors shown in plan (powder/P-toilet, bedroom/toilet doors, kitchen door) do not match the 3D positions/orientations. Window placement is simplified/unclear compared to the plan’s defined exterior openings. Room proportions (notably corridors, toilets, and kitchen/utility) appear distorted relative to the 2D dimensions.

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness looks visually consistent in the render, but plan-level structural fidelity is weak: several partitions are reshaped/relocated (curved/arched segments not in plan), changing adjacency and access logic. The plan indicates multiple toilets (including a small P-toilet near entrance and other toilets near bedrooms); the 3D does not clearly represent all of them as distinct enclosed rooms with correct doors. Kitchen/utility separation is not clearly maintained as a distinct enclosed utility room. Some correct adjacencies remain (balcony off living, bedroom wings), but several internal boundaries/door embeddings do not match the 2D.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture is plausible but not mapped to the plan: the 2D shows conventional enclosed kitchen and defined dining/living arrangement, while the 3D uses a more open kitchen/island-like setup and generic bedroom layouts. Scale is generally consistent visually, but placement does not faithfully follow the 2D layout and room extents (especially around dining/kitchen and corridor areas).

aesthetic_quality.notes: The isometric camera is coherent and the model is visually clean with good lighting/shadows and readable composition. However, it is not an orthographic-accurate translation of the plan (stylized curved geometry and open-plan treatment reduce projection fidelity). Geometry appears mostly clean with no major mesh artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Hallucinated curved/arched interior partitions around the central circulation/living area; the 2D plan uses straight walls and straight passages.
Proportion distortion: the plan’s two wide passages (left and right) are not preserved as straight corridor segments; circulation area appears widened/reshaped.
Missing/unclear dedicated P-toilet near the entrance as a distinct enclosed room with correct door (present in 2D plan).
Missing/unclear full set of toilets shown in plan (plan indicates multiple separate toilets; 3D does not clearly show all as enclosed rooms).
Door placement mismatch for interior rooms (bedroom and toilet doors do not align with the 2D door locations along the passages).
Door orientation/swing logic is inconsistent with the plan in the central area (arched/open entries replace planned hinged door placements).
Kitchen boundary/entry differs: the 2D shows a more enclosed kitchen with a defined doorway; 3D depicts a more open kitchen connection.
Utility room separation is missing/unclear (2D shows a distinct utility adjacent to kitchen; 3D does not clearly enclose it as a separate room).
Window placement is simplified/does not match the plan’s specific exterior window positions, especially along bedroom and kitchen/utility exterior walls.
Hallucinated furniture/layout elements (e.g., island/open kitchen arrangement) not supported by the 2D plan’s interior mapping.
